members.short_doc: Checks whether or not the passed number is within a desired range. ...

return.doc: The constrained value if outside the range, otherwise the current value
return.name: return

members.name: constrain
members.doc: Checks whether or not the passed number is within a desired range. If the number is already within the range it is returned, otherwise the min or max value is returned depending on which side of the range is exceeded. Note that this method returns the constrained value but does not change the current number.

members.short_doc: Validate that a value is numeric and convert it to a number if necessary. ...

params.doc: The value to return if the original value is non-numeric
params.name: defaultValue

members.name: from
members.doc:
Validate that a value is numeric and convert it to a number if necessary. Returns the specified default value if it is not.

Ext.Number.from('1.23', 1); // returns 1.23 Ext.Number.from('abc', 1); // returns 1

members.short_doc: Snaps the passed number between stopping points based upon a passed increment value. ...

params.doc: The increment by which the value must move.
params.name: increment

params.doc: The minimum value to which the returned value must be constrained. Overrides the increment..
params.name: minValue

params.doc: The maximum value to which the returned value must be constrained. Overrides the increment..
params.name: maxValue

return.doc: The value of the nearest snap target.
return.name: return

members.name: snap
members.doc: Snaps the passed number between stopping points based upon a passed increment value.

members.short_doc: Formats a number using fixed-point notation ...

params.doc: The number of digits to show after the decimal point
params.name: precision

members.name: toFixed

doc: A collection of useful static methods to deal with numbers
name: Ext.Number
